productData.compdesi: Ali Maffucci is the founder of the culinary brand Inspiralized, the ultimate resource for cooking creatively, healthfully and deliciously with the spiralizer, the kitchen tool that turns vegetables and fruits into noodles. Recently, she expanded her recipe content to include other inventive ways to transform vegetables, continually inspiring people to love and to eat more vegetables. In June of 2013, Ali quit her corporate job to pursue Inspiralized, starting first with her blog, Inspiralized.com. Since then, Maffucci has been referred to as a “digitally savvy millennial entrepreneur”, as well as the creator of a “spiral empire” by Food & Wine. Maffucci has authored New York Times best-selling cookbooks (Inspiralized and Inspiralize Everything) and her latest cookbook, Inspiralized and Beyond is following suit. Maffucci launched her branded spiralizer called the Inspiralizer and continues to provide daily free recipes on her food blog and through her iOS mobile app. She currently lives in Jersey City, NJ with her husband, Lu, her son, Luca and her daughter, Roma.

cookingSteps.microwave_steps: 1. Remove sleeve and peel corner of film to vent. Microwave for 2-4 mins or until heated through. Remove film.
cookingSteps.oven_steps: 1. Preheat to 350F. Remove sleeve and film.Heat up for 15-20 mins or until heated through.

ingredients.name: Carrots
ingredients.description: As all vegetables, carrots don´t have cholesterol but yes they do have lots of nutrients for you! They are an excellent source of beta-carotene, a pigment which has antioxidant properties and is the primary source of provitamin A. The body has the ability to convert beta-carotene into Vitamin A (retinol), which has multiple functions such as growth and development, reproduction, improving vision and boosting the immune system. Furthermore, carrots have other nutrients such as potassium and dietary fiber.

ingredients.name: Ginger
ingredients.description: Ginger has been a popular ingredient and herbal medicine for thousands of years in Asian, Indian, and Arabic herbal traditions. Fresh or dried, ginger´s spicy and strong taste brings life to your meals and also adds powerful benefits. Because of its gingerol, it can be used to prevent or treat nausea and vomiting from motion sickness, pregnancy, and in some cases cancer chemotherapy. It is also used to treat mild stomach upset, to reduce pain of osteoarthritis, and may even be used in heart disease and nasal allergies. Ongoing investigations suggest that it may help improve blood sugar control in type 2 diabetes. Ginger is rich in manganese, and has moderate amounts of magnesium and vitamin B6.

ingredients.name: Ground Black Pepper
ingredients.description: Because of its antibacterial properties, pepper is also used to preserve food. It is a rich source of manganese, iron, potassium, vitamin-C, vitamin K, and dietary fiber. Black pepper is also a very good anti-inflammatory agent.

ingredients.name: Kosher Salt
ingredients.description: Also known as koshering salt, it is specially recognized because of its flake-like shape. Even though all three salts- sea, table and kosher- contain the same amount of sodium per gram, kosher salt yields less sodium per tablespoon because of its coarser grain. In other words, it enhances the flavor of each ingredient while protecting your heart from an excessive sodium intake!!

ingredients.name: Leeks
ingredients.description: Leeks are allium vegetables that are closely related to onions, garlic, shallots, and scallions. With a milder flavor and larger size, they work well added to everything from salads to soups, where they add beneficial fiber and bulk along with vitamins, minerals, and antioxidant polyphenols.

ingredients.name: Lemon
ingredients.description: As a refreshing drink, lemonade helps you to stay calm and cool. The health benefits of lemons are due to its many nourishing elements like vitamin C, vitamin B6, vitamin A, vitamin E, folate, niacin thiamin, riboflavin, pantothenic acid, copper, calcium, iron, magnesium, potassium, zinc, phosphorus and protein.

ingredients.name: Lemon Juice
ingredients.description: As a refreshing drink, lemonade helps you stay calm and cool. The health benefits of it are due to its many nourishing nutrients such as vitamin C and potassium while having no fat and therefore no cholesterol.  Unlike most animals, humans are not able to synthesize vitamin C, so it becomes a crucial dietary component. Also recognized as ascorbic acid, it is mostly known because of its antioxidant properties, but it also helps in the synthesis of collagen (growth and repair of connective tissue), the healing of wounds, and the functioning of the immune system. Vitamin C is also very important in a vegetarian diet as it helps absorb the iron in plant-based foods. Half a cup of lemon juice covers approximately a 77% of vitamin´s C daily recommendation.

ingredients.name: Olive Oil
ingredients.description: The main type of fat found in all kinds of olive oil is monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFAs). MUFA s are considered a healthy dietary fat. If you replace saturated and trans fats with unsaturated fats, such as MUFA s and polyunsaturated fats (PUFAs), you may gain certain health benefits.

ingredients.name: Tarragon
ingredients.description: Tarragon is an excellent source of minerals such as magnesium, iron, zinc, and calcium. The herb is rich in Vitamin A and Vitamin C as well as B-6. Tarragon contains antioxidants that help to neutralize free radicals in the body.

ingredients.name: Turmeric
ingredients.description: Turmeric may prevent and slow the progression of Alzheimer's disease by removing amyloyd plaque buildup in the brain. It may prevent metastases from occurring in many different forms of cancer. ... Because of its anti-inflammatory properties, turm...

ingredients.name: Unsalted Butter
ingredients.description: Butter, commonly known as makkhan, is a pure form of animal fat as it is prepared at home and fresh. Adding one teaspoon of butter in the diet is highly recommended as it is rich in antioxidants and contains carotene, vitamin A. In fact, lining rotis or parathas with butter or adding a teaspoon in hot rice is enough for reaping its health benefits.

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.description: Drinking Water Helps Maintain the Balance of Body Fluids. Your body is composed of about 60% water. The functions of these bodily fluids include digestion, absorption, circulation, creation of saliva, transportation of nutrients, and maintenance of body temperature.

productData.meal_story: A salmon meal worthy to make your day diverse! Salmon is a fish you can enjoy because of its low mercury content. The fish and asparagus is oven- baked with garlic and parsley.

reviews.title: I tried 9 different dishes ...
reviews.detail:
I tried 9 different dishes off of CookUnity.  This fish and carrots were both very tasty and had great texture.  My only complaint is that it felt like it was missing a carb, and the portion was too small.  Fortunately, I ate this at home so I was able to easily resolve these issues by making some rice in my rice cooker.  Including the rice I made, this was my favorite of the 9 different meals that I ordered.  It didn't take much effort and it was preferable to other meals I got that had no vegetables since making rice doesn't require any fresh ingredients, but it's mildly annoying that I had to do it.

Here is my full ranking:
Beef bibimbap
Sautéed gulf hake (+$3)
Roasted Faroe island salmon (+$3)
Jerk lamb meat balls
Bulgogi ramen
Roasted salmon with pineapple fried
Lamb kebab turmeric hummus
Rosemary chicken thigh
Slow roasted Cornish hen

My profile:
Male, mid 20s, average height, slim build, harsh rater, moderately active, values tasty and balanced meals with protein, vegetables, and carbs.

reviews.title: I've eaten at Jean George ...
reviews.detail: I've eaten at Jean George and JoJo and know that the food will be excellent with smaller portions. That's fine with me as I prefer quality over quantity. However the fish was a 3" thin square with 5 baby carrots. The photo must have it on a bread and butter plate. And you're charged extra. Come on Jean George don't be so stingy.
